post.description:
Requests a list of document boxes within the tenant optionally filtered to
a specific query with support for wildcards

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: ID of the tenant you are targeting

parameters.name: x-tenant-env
parameters.description: Environment of the tenant you are targeting

400.description: Malformed or invalid request not meeting validation requirements

post.description:
Empties all the database pool and credentials caches, you can use this endpoint
if you rotate your database credentials to refresh the database pool without
needing to restart the server

Clears the tenant cache, you can use this endpoint if you've updated the
tenant configuration and want it to be applied immediately without
restarting the server

Purges all expired presigned tasks, this operation deletes any presigned uploads
that have not yet been completed but have passed the expiration date

Rebuild the tenant search index from the data stored in the database
and in storage

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: ID of the tenant you are targeting

parameters.name: x-tenant-env
parameters.description: Environment of the tenant you are targeting

post.description:
Useful if a files were previously accepted into the tenant with some unknown
file type (or ingested through a source that was unable to get the correct mime).

Will reprocess files that have this unknown file type mime to see if a different
type can be obtained

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: ID of the tenant you are targeting

parameters.name: x-tenant-env
parameters.description: Environment of the tenant you are targeting

Performs a search across multiple document box scopes. This

Access control for this should probably be restricted
on other end to prevent users from deleting an entire
bucket?

post.description:
Uploads a new document to the provided document box folder.

If the asynchronous option is specified a task will be returned
otherwise the completed file upload will be returned directly

In a browser environment its recommend to use the async option to
prevent running into browser timeouts if the processing takes too long.

In a reverse proxy + browser situation prefer using the presigned file upload
endpoint otherwise browsers may timeout while your server transfers the file

Synchronous uploads return [UploadedFile]
Asynchronous uploads return [UploadTaskResponse]

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope to create the file within

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: ID of the tenant you are targeting

parameters.name: x-tenant-env
parameters.description: Environment of the tenant you are targeting

parameters.description: Optional ID of the user if performed on behalf of a user

parameters.name: x-user-name
parameters.description: Optional name of the user if performed on behalf of a user

parameters.name: x-user-image-id
parameters.description: Optional image ID of the user if performed on behalf of a user

400.description: Malformed or invalid request not meeting validation requirements

404.description: Target folder could not be found

409.description: Fixed ID is already in use

get.description:
Requests the raw contents of a file, this is used for downloading
the file or viewing it in the browser or simply requesting its content

This is identical to [get_raw] except it takes an additional catch-all
tail parameter that's used to give a file name to the browser for things
like the in-browser PDF viewers. Browsers (Chrome) don't always listen to the
Content-Disposition file name so this is required

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope the file resides within

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: ID of the file to query

get.description: Check that the server is running using this endpoint
Requests options and settings from docbox
Request basic details about the server

AdminSearchRequest.description:
Extended search request to search within multiple document
boxes

BinaryResponse.description: Type hint type for Utoipa to indicate a binary response type

CreateDocumentBoxRequest.description: Request to create a document box

scope.description: Scope for the document box to use

folder_id.description: ID of the folder to store folder in

CreateLink.description: Request to create a document box

folder_id.description: ID of the folder to store link in

CreatePresignedRequest.description: Request to create a new presigned file upload

disable_mime_sniffing.description:
Whether to disable mime sniffing for the file. When false/not specified
if a application/octet-stream mime type is provided the file name
will be used to attempt to determine the real mime type

folder_id.description: ID of the folder to store the file in

name.description: Name of the file being uploaded

parent_id.description:
Optional ID of the parent file if this file is associated as a child
of another file. Mainly used to associating attachments to email files

size.description:
Size of the file being uploaded in bytes. Must match the size of the
file being uploaded

created_at.description: Date of creation for the document box

max_file_size.description: Max allowed upload file size in bytes

DocumentBoxResponse.description: Response for requesting a document box

children.description: Resolved contents of the root folder

root.description: Root folder of the document box

DocumentBoxScope.description: Valid document box scope string, must be: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, ':', '-', '_', '.'

file_size.description: Total size of the files contained within the document box

total_files.description: Total number of files within the document box

total_folders.description: Total number of folders within the document box

total_links.description: Total number of links within the document box

file_id.description: ID of the file that was edited (If a file was edited)

folder_id.description: ID of the file that was edited (If a folder was edited)

id.description: Unique identifier for this history entry

link_id.description: ID of the file that was edited (If a link was edited)

type.description: The type of change that was made

EditHistoryMetadata.description: Metadata associated with an edit history

skip_attachments.description: Whether to skip extracting attachments when processing an email

encrypted.description: Whether the file was determined to be encrypted when processing

hash.description: Hash of the file bytes stored in S3

mime.description: Mime type of the file content

parent_id.description:
Optional parent file ID if the file is a child of
some other file (i.e attachment for an email file)

pinned.description: Whether the file is marked as pinned

size.description: Size of the file in bytes

FileResponse.description: Response for requesting a document box

generated.description: Files generated from the file (thumbnails, pdf, etc)

FileSearchRequest.description: Request to search within a file

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

offset.description: Offset to start returning results from

last_modified_at.description: Last time the file was modified

FileWithExtra.description: File with the resolved creator and last modified data

document_box.description: ID of the document box the folder belongs to

folder_id.description: Parent folder ID if the folder is a child

pinned.description: Whether the folder is marked as pinned

FolderResponse.description: Response for requesting a document box

last_modified_at.description: Last time the folder was modified

GeneratedFile.description: File generated as an artifact of an uploaded file

file_id.description: File this generated file belongs  to

hash.description: Hash of the file this was generated from

mime.description: Mime type of the generated file content

GetPresignedRequest.description: Request to rename and or move a file

expires_at.description: Expiry time in seconds for the presigned URL

HttpErrorResponse.description: HTTP error JSON format for serializing responses

last_modified_at.description: Last time the file was modified

oneOf.description: User who last modified the link

PresignedUploadResponse.description:
Response describing how to upload the presigned file and the ID
for polling the progress

headers.description: Headers to include on the file upload request

method.description: HTTP method to use when uploading the file

task_id.description: ID of the file upload task to poll

uri.description: URL to upload the file to

max_unpack_iterations.description:
Maximum number of times to unpack a file. When unpacking
things like email attachments, these are recursively this
limits the number of nested unpacking that can occur.

Default: 1 (Unpack Only the immediate children)

ResolvedFolderWithExtra.description:
Folder with all the children resolved, children also
resolve the user and last modified data

files.description: List of files within the folder

folders.description: List of folders within the folder

links.description: List of links within the folder

SearchRequest.description: Request to search within a document box

folder_id.description:
Enforce search to a specific folder, empty for all
folders

max_pages.description: Maximum number of pages too return per file

mime.description: Search only include a specific mime type

pages_offset.description: Offset to start at when aggregating page results

size.description: Number of items to include in the response

path.description: Path to the search result item

oneOf.description: OpenSearch and database use float scoring

Task.description: Represents a stored asynchronous task progress

document_box.description: ID of the document box the task belongs to

output_data.description: Output data from the task completion

query.description: Optional query to search document boxes by

size.description: Number of items to include in the response

total.description: The total number of document boxes available to query

file_size.description: Total size of all files within the tenant

total_files.description: Total number of files within the document box

total_folders.description: Total number of folders within the document box

total_links.description: Total number of links within the document box

UpdateFileRequest.description: Request to rename and or move a file

folder_id.description: New parent folder for the folder

UpdateFolderRequest.description: Request to rename and or move a folder

folder_id.description: ID of the new parent folder for the folder
New parent folder ID for the link

asynchronous.description:
Whether to process the file asynchronously returning a task
response instead of waiting for the upload

disable_mime_sniffing.description:
Whether to disable mime sniffing for the file. When false/not specified
if a application/octet-stream mime type is provided the file name
will be used to attempt to determine the real mime type

file.description:
The actual file you are uploading, ensure the mime type for the file
is set correctly

fixed_id.description:
Fixed file ID the file must use. Should only be used for
migrating existing files and maintaining the same UUID.

Should not be provided for general use

folder_id.description: ID of the folder to store the file in

mime.description:
Optional mime type override, when not present the mime type will
be extracted from [UploadFileRequest::file]

name.description: Name of the file being uploaded

parent_id.description:
Optional ID of the parent file if this file is associated as a child
of another file. Mainly used to associating attachments to email files

additional_files.description: Additional files created and uploaded from processing the file

image_id.description: Last saved image ID for the user

name.description: Last saved name for the user

path.description: Path to the search result item
